thread.title: Join Julia Bradbury for an exclusive travel event
thread.title_full: Join Julia Bradbury for an exclusive travel event - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Join Julia Bradbury for an exclusive travel event
text: Outdoor girl, Julia Bradbury, is best know for presenting BBC Countryfile and you are invited to join the television star for an evening of travel inspiration. At this exclusive free event, the former Countryfile presenter will talk about her globetrotting adventures, which have seen her walking some of Britain’s most beautiful areas , as well as exploring South Africa, Iceland and Germany. Join the “roving ambassador” for Ramblers Worldwide Holidays at the event hosted at the Telegraph building in London on 15 October 2015. Journalist and interviewer Jeremy Skidmore will host the question-and-answer session with the outdoor enthusiast as she shares travel tales and her favourite walking adventures. Julia Bradbury began her national television career as the Los Angeles correspondent for morning show GMTV before progressing to host television programmes including Watchdog , Accidental Heroes , Wainwright Walks and Railway Walks . As well as co-hosting Countryfile , Julia also filmed a variety of other series celebrating the British countryside and abundance of nature, as well as walking trips around the world. Her love of the outdoors has given her plenty of opportunity to try exciting new activities for television, such as joining rock climber Tim Emmett to climb several ascents, including Cornwall’s Commando Ridge and the Old Man of Stoer, in Sutherland, Scotland. The adventurer explains: “I always say that you feel the soul of a country through the soles of your feet.” Doors for the event will open from 6pm, with refreshments served until the event begins at 7pm. The Telegraph building is located at 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London, SW1W 0SR. • Complete the form below to sign up for this exclusive event Online Form - Join Julia Bradbury for an exclusive travel event
